text: Zsuzsa Vanyek (born 18 January 1960) is a Hungarian female former track and field athlete who competed in the long jump, triple jump and the heptathlon. She won 25 national titles indoors and outdoors, including 18 in the long jump and five in heptathlon.Hungarian Championships. GBR Athletics. Retrieved 2018-02-18.Hungarian Indoor Championships. GBR Athletics. Retrieved 2018-02-18. She represented her country at the 1982 European Athletics Championships, finishing ninth in long jump and twelfth in heptathlon, and at the 1983 World Championships in Athletics, where she was sixth in the long jump final with a lifetime best jump of . She competed at four editions of the European Athletics Indoor Championships, which her best placing being sixth in 1983.Zsuzsa Vanyek. Track and Field Statistics. Retrieved 2018-02-18.Zsuzsa Vanyek. IAAF.
